description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. Number of lines per page varies. Written in several scripts, mostly casual medium large naskh, in black ink. Dark cream paper with chain and laid lines visible. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals, counting the first flyleaf as fol. 1. Text 3 (Faṣl al-munāzaʻah) was copied on 25 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 746 (fol. 16a).
author: Sharīshī, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, 1294?-1368?
abstract: Collection of texts on fiqh and ḥadīth.
contents: 11. fol. 42a-52b: [Several paragraphs dealing mostly with legal matters, starting with a quotation from Sharaf al-Dīn al-Mursī (d. Rabīʻ al-Awwal 655/1257). Ibn ʻAqīl is also quoted (fol. 49b)].
extent: i, 51 leaves: paper ; 189 x 132 (160 x 112) mm. bound to 188 x 143 mm.
title: Fawāʼid fiqhīyah ... [etc.].
provenance: Waqf (see note on fol. 4a, 12b, etc.). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: شريشي، محمد بن احمد
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Brown leather over paper pasteboard (visible). The upper and lower covers are similarly blind tooled with a central square pattern and an outer frame consisting of an s-shape running pattern and several fillets. Rebacked. Damaged.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
